alert.note: Alert for Kandiyohi; Meeker; Stearns; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:16AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Wright, Meeker, southeastern Stearns and northeastern Kandiyohi Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 216 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New London, or 14 miles northeast of Willmar, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Paynesville around 220 AM CDT. Grove City around 225 AM CDT. Watkins around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kimball. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 74 and 114. U.S. Highway 8 in Minnesota near mile marker 6. U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 121 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central Minnesota.
